ratings.comment: Johnston was not a good professor for this upper-level theoretical math classes.  He would actually refer to large sections of proofs as "hand wavy" a few times each lecture.

He's very good at explaining the material, and his lecture notes are pretty good. The homework takes forever and will destroy your weekends. The exams are fairly difficult given how squeezed for time you'll feel, but (usually) nothing from out of left field. If you put in the effort, AB is pretty much the worst case scenario.

I would recommend Professor Johnston for anyone who needs or wants to take differential equations. Very clear during lecture. Very happy to answer questions. Puts lecture notes online prior to lecture and are honestly better than the text book.

The course was tough and the final exam was brutal (luckily the grading scale is extremely generous), but I cannot imagine a better professor for this class. He articulates well, gets you interested and explains concepts clearly. If you have trouble understanding something, he is very good at checking email and his office hours are reasonable.

Best math professor I've had so far. Online notes are immensely helpful, I wish every math prof did the same. Example problems give enough info to succeed on homework and exams. Speaks loud and clear in lecture. Gives challenging homework problems that really make you learn the material. Overall, awesome prof. Final exam was long, but expected.

This guy is great. He presents everything clearly and thoroughly. His typed notes are excellent, so you don't even have to take notes during class and can pay attention to the actual lecture itself (or not go at all...) Homework can be lengthy but is doable and the midterms were fair, but the final surprisingly difficult. Never used the book.

Good professor, nice guy. His lectures are generally clear and although he does his job well he always seems rather disinterested in whatever he's teaching. Also very willing to help during office hours. His online notes are extremely helpful. Midterms are fair. Final was ridiculously hard. I would definitely recommend him.

As others have stated, he types up his own notes and teaches from them. Because of this, it's really not necessary to attend lecture unless clarification is needed. I had Professor Johnston for both Math 320 and 319, and I have nothing but the highest praise for him as a professor.

Best math professor I've had at UW. His lectures actually coincide with the homework (what?! who would have guessed that was a thing!) and the tests are just like the homework with a few theory problems thrown in that we discussed in lecture- but definitely a fair grader. Great professor
Awesome professor.  Very fair grader.  Do the work and you will be more than fine.
Very helpful! Posts notes online that are clear and concise. (Exactly what he teaches and very thorough)Also hot (another reason to go to lecture) ;)
Awesome. One of the best professors I've had.
Great professor! Explains and clarifies material very well. I would definitely recommend him!
